title: Implement LLVM codegen skeleton (module, function defs, entry point)
body:
Implement the basic LLVM code generation framework that translates GRIN definitions into LLVM IR.

**Deliverables:**
- `LlvmCodegen` struct that takes a `GrinProgram` and produces an LLVM module
- Generate LLVM function definitions for each GRIN `GrinDef`
- Generate the `main` entry point that calls the GRIN `main` function
- Define LLVM types for GRIN values: tagged nodes, heap pointers, literals
- Emit LLVM IR to a file (`.ll`) for debugging
- Compile LLVM module to object code and link into an executable
- Smoke test: a trivial GRIN program that returns an exit code

**Design notes:**
- Node representation in LLVM: tagged union (tag word + payload words)
- Heap pointers are LLVM `ptr` (opaque pointers, LLVM 15+)
- The runtime functions (alloc, eval, apply) are declared as external and linked from the Zig runtime
